unitree_legged_sdk.example_py.Bezier.main_loop¶

unitree_legged_sdk.example_py.Bezier.main_loop.main_loop(trajectories, trajectory, TOTAL_OFFSET, neurons_coords, parts, stand_up_1, stand_up_2, stand_up_3)[source]¶

The main control loop for managing the robot’s movement, including standing up, walking, and lying down.

Parameters

  • trajectories (dict) – A dictionary containing the movement trajectories for each limb (FR, FL, RR, RL).

  • trajectory (list) – A list of control points used to generate the foot trajectory.

  • TOTAL_OFFSET (int) – The total offset applied to the trajectories for phase-shifting limb movements.

  • neurons_coords (dict) – Precomputed neuron coordinates used to simulate the robot’s movement.

  • parts (list of str) – A list of parts (limbs) being controlled, including ‘FR’ (Front Right), ‘FL’ (Front Left), ‘RR’ (Rear Right), and ‘RL’ (Rear Left).

  • stand_up_1 (dict) – Dictionaries containing the joint angle trajectories for the robot’s standing up procedure.

  • stand_up_2 (dict) – Dictionaries containing the joint angle trajectories for the robot’s standing up procedure.

  • stand_up_3 (dict) – Dictionaries containing the joint angle trajectories for the robot’s standing up procedure.
